Car Photography: A Beginner’s How-To Guide And Tips

Cars carry different meaning for different people. For some, it’s a necessity to get from one place to another. To a certain group, cars provide a sense of independence and adventure; creating that exciting adrenaline rush a lot of people crave for. To others, an attractive car photography works as a stairway to achieving and maintaining a position in high society.

A car is something you’ll use for many years. It will become a partner in your journeys and carry memories that you’ll never forget. It’s also a big investment and you expect to get long-term benefits from it as well. This is why; it’s normal to put a lot of thought into buying a car. Regardless of the type of need you have for it, as a user, you are bound to agree that is it a beautiful piece of machinery. Photographing something so exquisite and valuable will obviously require your full attention, skill set and expertise. It’s an art form and you must master it. Just like any art form, you will need some guidance that will lead you to be have perfect car photographs and this blog will provide you just that.


DID YOU KNOW?

- ACCORDING TO A STUDY BY STATISTA, GLOBAL AVERAGE AUTOMOBILE SELLS GO UP TO 70 MILLION EVERY YEAR

Cars are a big investment for anyone. In order to turn it into a wise decision, a potential buyer would first evaluate all their alternative options. And in this modern era of internet, the easier way to do this is by observing and analyzing car photos.

Tips and Hacks for high quality car photography

Once you master the art, cars can be one of the most exciting things to photograph. The shiny color, flashy mirrors and fancy parts makes them inherently attractive. You can be a car seller wanting to highlight important features of the vehicle or a new car owner looking to picturize the memorable event. When motivations for photographing the same product is different, then different aspects will come out. Either way, some tips and guide regarding background, lighting and angles can help make all the difference in your product photographs.


Make sure the Products up for reselling are clean

As the stuff you’re about to sell has been in use for a specific time, you need to make sure they are properly dusted and cleaned before you photograph and resell your old products. If it’s old furniture; you can dust or vacuum it and then wipe up with a cloth soaked in mild soap. If it’s a part of your wardrobe, get it washed and ironed properly. Make sure there’s no stain or crease as that can make a photo look unappealing and reduce the product’s attractiveness. Cleaning instructions vary for clothes, electronics and furniture. So make sure you look them up and understand it all before you start cleaning.

Ensure Consistency in Themes for Product Reselling

Themes help decide the layout of your picture. It’s important that you pick a theme that highlights your products in the right manner. While photographing old stuff, it may see lucrative to work with monochrome (black and white) themes as that helps create a more vintage look. But as you do this, you will not be able to highlight the true color of your product. So it’s better to avoid this for product reselling purposes. You can try shooting from above to give your customers a full view. Make sure you take super close up shots (also referred to as macro-shots) to highlight different features as well. Also make sure, you follow the similar theme and pattern for all your products so it’s more eye-soothing.

Props for popping the product up

You can use interesting little props that would help with the storytelling and make the photo speak up. As reselling includes products that have been used in the past, try to take inspiration from the trends that were hyped back then. For example- if it’s an old school vintage camera, you can think of adding using wood tables and camera rolls as tools. In case of wearable, you can even think of using products as props. For instance- pair up a jacket you want to sell with the pair of matching boots you don’t use anymore. This will serve a two way purpose and make sales easier.


Don’t hide the shortcomings

A research of TrueShip shows that 20% of all product returns happen because customers receive damaged products. As you use a product for some time, it is bound to get stained or damaged in some way. The best you can do is repairing the damages before you put for sell. If the damage is visible, don’t try to hide it. Make sure the damaged parts are visible in the photographs. If it’s not visible, mention the damage and the steps taken by you to minimize it in the product description. After all, honesty is the best policy!


Post Production Processes for Product Reselling Photography

As you are done with photographing your products, half of your worries should be gone. Now it’s time to process the product photos properly. You can either do it yourself using Photoshop or consider taking professional help from image and video editing services. Outsourcing such help will save both your time and get the expert touch that gives your product a final edge.

Another way to go with old product is donating them to luxury item reseller’s like- Shop Repurpose and letting them take care of all your old stuff worries. By donating, you are contributing to the society and getting rid of unused stuff from your wardrobe; enabling you to make space for new ones. It is obvious that capturing photos and selling old products will take some effort. But it’s all worth it because of the happiness it offers.
